availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James E. Gorin (Barren County, Kentucky, boss)

body.p: Barren County, Kentucky, boss. Kentucky native. Son of Thomas J. Gorin and Mary A. Gorin. Married to Mary Rogers Gorin in Barren County, Kentucky, on January 16, 1862. Resident in Glasgow in 1850. Boss in Glasgow in 1860. Owned one enslaved individual in Barren County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, Glasgow Division 1, p. 402A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, Glasgow District 1, p. 745.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, District 1, p. 47A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Barren County Marriages, Film #000216816.
Find A Grave, "James Edward Gorin (Aug 29, 1835-May 9, 1896)," Memorial #78575970, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/78575970 (accessed April 27, 2020).
